content: दीक्षित {%<ab>p. p.</ab>%} [दीक्ष् कर्त्तरि क्त, दीक्षा जाताऽस्य तार°इतच् वा] {@--1@} Consecrated, initiated (as for a religious ceremony;) एते विवाहदीक्षिता यूयं <ls>U. 1</ls>; <ls>Pt. 1. 167</ls>; आपन्नाभयसत्रेषु दीक्षिताः खलु पौरवाः <ls>Ś. 2. 16</ls>; <ls>R. 8. 75</ls>, <ls n="R.">11. 24</ls>, <ls>Ve. 1. 25.</ls> {@--2@} Prepared for a sacrifice. {@--3@} Prepared for, having taken a vow of; <ls>R. 11. 67.</ls> {@--4@} Crowned; <ls>R. 4. 5.</ls> {@--5@} Performed, (as the दीक्षा ceremony). --तः {@--1@} A priest engaged in a Dīkṣā. {@--2@} A pupil. {@--3@} A person who or whose ancestors may have performed a grand sacrificial ceremony, such as ज्योतिष्टोम.
